question: [File: aptos-core/config/src/config/node_config_loader.rs] [Function: load_and_sanitize_config()] [Config File Permissions] Is there validation that config files at line 74 have correct permissions preventing unauthorized modification by other users? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/node_config_loader.rs] [Function: get_chain_id()] [Genesis Transaction Authentication] Does get_genesis_txn() at line 162 verify cryptographic signatures on the genesis transaction to prevent tampering? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/node_config_loader.rs] [Function: sanitize_node_config()] [Sanitization Authority] Can unprivileged code call sanitize_node_config() to re-sanitize configs with attacker-controlled parameters? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/node_config_loader.rs] [Function: extract_from_config()] [VFN Network Bypass] At line 50, if is_vfn_network() is bypassed, could public nodes gain access to private validator-fullnode communications? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/node_config_loader.rs] [Function: extract_from_config()] [Network Config Injection] Can attackers inject additional network configs into full_node_networks at line 48 to access restricted network segments? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/node_config_loader.rs] [Function: optimize_and_sanitize_node_config()] [Network Isolation Violation] Does sanitization at line 144 properly enforce network segmentation between validators, VFNs, and PFNs? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/node_config_loader.rs] [Function: load_and_sanitize_config()] [Config Persistence] After sanitization at line 87, is the sanitized config persisted, or could the node reload the original malicious config on restart? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/node_config_loader.rs] [Function: get_chain_id()] [Genesis Cache Poisoning] Is the extracted chain ID cached, and if so, could cache poisoning cause incorrect chain IDs to persist across restarts? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/node_config_loader.rs] [Function: get_local_config_yaml()] [YAML Merge Key Attack] Can YAML merge keys (<<: *anchor) be exploited to override security-critical config values after validation? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/node_config_loader.rs] [Function: get_local_config_yaml()] [YAML Tag Injection] Does the YAML parser at line 99 allow custom tags (!!) that could trigger unsafe deserialization or code execution? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/node_config_loader.rs] [Function: get_local_config_yaml()] [YAML Alias Bomb] Can recursive YAML aliases cause infinite loops or stack overflows during parsing at line 99? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/node_config_loader.rs] [Function: load_and_sanitize_config()] [Partial Load Failure] If execution.load_from_path() at line 78 fails, is the partially loaded node_config cleaned up, or does it remain in an inconsistent state? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/node_config_loader.rs] [Function: get_chain_id()] [Genesis Load Failure] If get_genesis_txn() returns None at line 162, the error is returned - but are there code paths that continue execution anyway? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/node_config_loader.rs] [Function: extract_node_type_and_chain_id()] [Silent Failure Mode] At line 120, chain ID extraction failure is logged but returns None - can nodes operate unsafely in this failure mode? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/node_config_loader.rs] [Function: get_chain_id()] [WriteSet Integrity] Is there cryptographic verification of the write_set at line 172 to ensure genesis transaction integrity? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/node_config_loader.rs] [Function: get_chain_id()] [StateKey Derivation] At line 169, StateKey::on_chain_config::<ChainId>() derives a key - is this derivation cryptographically sound and collision-resistant? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/node_config_loader.rs] [Function: load_and_sanitize_config()] [Concurrent Load Race] Can multiple threads call load_and_sanitize_config() simultaneously, causing race conditions in file access or config state? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/node_config_loader.rs] [Function: sanitize_node_config()] [Mutable Reference Race] The &mut node_config at line 148 could be accessed by other threads - are there proper locks preventing concurrent modification? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/node_config_loader.rs] [Function: optimize_and_sanitize_node_config()] [Concurrent Optimization] Can optimize() and sanitize() be interrupted by concurrent operations, leaving configs in partially modified states? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/node_config_loader.rs] [Function: extract_from_config()] [Validator Impersonation] Can a malicious config claim to be a validator at line 41-42 without proper cryptographic credentials, allowing unauthorized consensus participation? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/node_config_loader.rs] [Function: extract_from_config()] [Validator Downgrade] Could a legitimate validator be misclassified as a fullnode through config manipulation, removing it from consensus and reducing Byzantine fault tolerance? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/node_config_loader.rs] [Function: get_chain_id()] [Genesis Transaction Replay] Can an old genesis transaction be replayed to change the chain ID and fork the network? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/node_config_loader.rs] [Function: get_chain_id()] [Genesis Transaction Type Confusion] At line 168, only Direct WriteSetPayload is accepted - are there other payload types that should be rejected but aren't? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/node_config_loader.rs] [Function: get_chain_id()] [Genesis WriteOp Validation] Is there validation that the write_op at line 173 actually writes a valid ChainId and not other arbitrary data? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/node_config_loader.rs] [Function: load_and_sanitize_config()] [Hard Link Attack] Can hard links be used to point multiple config paths to the same file, causing unexpected behavior when configs are modified? (Low)
